instruction: Explain the conflict between two characters in the following story.
input: John and Bill have been lifelong rivals since their first meeting when they competed for a job at the same company.
output: John and Bill have been rivals for many years due to their competing for the same job. This has caused tension between them ever since, as each strives to be the better one and have the job over the other. This conflict has been further fuelled by their competitive nature and their determination to be the best.
